page.title: 09Attitudes - Cronton Village
page.content: Attitudes,Rural Environment;Most are happy with its rural environment and its close proximity and reasonable access to major towns and cities in the area. Facilities; The lack of facilities in the village is compensated by those found outside. County Boundaries; Concern was expressed when these were rearranged but now most people accept being part of the Met.Boro. of Knowsley. It is their Ed. Com. that is responsible for both aided primary schools and although it also provides secondary places for these children, most are accommodated in Widnes (Cheshire). The movement across boundaries is only restricted by lack of places in the chosen secondary schools. Green belt; Cronton is situated within a green belt area and people would prefer this to remain intact.
